intro: Trollius americanus lusus plurisepalus, commonly known as the many-lobed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow, saucer-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants known for their fluffy seed heads and showy blooms.
